info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 5 at 8:50AM CDT by NWS Shreveport LA
info.description:
...The National Weather Service in Shreveport has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Texas...
Sabine River At Longview affecting Gregg and Rusk Counties.
For the Sabine River...including Longview...Minor flooding is forecast.
* WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast.
* WHERE...Sabine River at Longview.
* WHEN...From late Monday night until further notice.
* IMPACTS...At 28.0 feet, Lowland flooding will continue for several days. Oil field operations will be curtailed and timber resources will suffer severe flooding. Fisherman should use caution as currents are swift.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 8:00 AM CDT Saturday the stage was 9.8 feet. - Bankfull stage is 25.0 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage early Tuesday morning and continue rising to 28.6 feet Thursday morning. Additional rises are possible thereafter. - Flood stage is 25.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 28.8 feet on 01/31/1995. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction:
Do not drive cars through flooded areas. Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas.
For more hydrologic information, copy and paste the following website address into your favorite web browser URL bar: https://water.noaa.gov/wfo/SHV
The next statement will be issued Sunday morning at 900 AM CDT.
